function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Inadequate consideration of specific user groups in biophilic design may lead to inadequate health and well-being outcomes for certain individuals.","Impact":"Increased risk of stress, discomfort, and reduced well-being for medical workers, patients, and other building occupants.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough user group analysis and consider age, gender, and specific requirements to ensure inclusive biophilic design.","Technologies":"Building information modeling (BIM) for simulating user experiences.","People":"Medical workers, patients, patients' family members, building occupants.","Owner":"Architects, interior designers, building owners."},{"Description":"Inadequate quantification of exposure time to nature and contact frequency may result in suboptimal biophilic design outcomes.","Impact":"Limited improvement in health and well-being due to insufficient exposure to natural elements.","Mitigation":"Utilize sensors and monitoring technology to quantify exposure time and contact frequency, and integrate data into design decisions.","Technologies":"Environmental sensors, IoT devices, data analytics for behavioral patterns.","People":"Architects, interior designers, building consultants.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers."},{"Description":"Lack of scientific substantiation and quantitative evaluation in biophilic architecture may lead to unverified design concepts and ineffective implementation.","Impact":"Potential waste of resources, limited effectiveness in improving health and well-being, and skepticism towards biophilic design strategies.","Mitigation":"Collaborate with researchers and experts in environmental psychology to validate design concepts and conduct rigorous scientific evaluation.","Technologies":"Data analytics for performance measurement, collaboration platforms for research engagement.","People":"Architects, researchers, environmental psychologists, building owners.","Owner":"Building owners, research institutions."}]}
